content: 1 The Song of songs, which is Solomon’s.
content_old: 1 The Song of songs, which is Solomon’s.

content: 2 Let him kiss me with the kisses of his mouth; For thy love is better than wine.
content_old: 2 Let him kiss me with the kisses of his mouth; For thy love is better than wine.

content: 3 Thine oils have a goodly fragrance; Thy name is as oil poured forth; Therefore do the virgins love thee.
content_old: 3 Thine oils have a goodly fragrance; Thy name is as oil poured forth; Therefore do the virgins love thee.

content: 4 Draw me; we will run after thee: The king hath brought me into his chambers; We will be glad and rejoice in thee; We will make mention of thy love more than of wine: Rightly do they love thee.
content_old: 4 Draw me; we will run after thee: The king hath brought me into his chambers; We will be glad and rejoice in thee; We will make mention of thy love more than of wine: Rightly do they love thee.

content: 5 I am black, but comely, Oh ye daughters of Jerusalem, As the tents of Kedar, As the curtains of Solomon.
content_old: 5 I am black, but comely, Oh ye daughters of Jerusalem, As the tents of Kedar, As the curtains of Solomon.

content: 6 Look not upon me, because I am swarthy, Because the sun hath scorched me. My mother’s sons were incensed against me; They made me keeper of the vineyards; But mine own vineyard have I not kept.
content_old: 6 Look not upon me, because I am swarthy, Because the sun hath scorched me. My mother’s sons were incensed against me; They made me keeper of the vineyards; But mine own vineyard have I not kept.

content: 7 Tell me, O thou whom my soul loveth, Where thou feedest thy flock, Where thou makest it to rest at noon: For why should I be as one that is veiled Beside the flocks of thy companions?
content_old: 7 Tell me, O thou whom my soul loveth, Where thou feedest thy flock, Where thou makest it to rest at noon: For why should I be as one that is veiled Beside the flocks of thy companions?

content: 8 If thou know not, O thou fairest among women, Go thy way forth by the footsteps of the flock, And feed thy kids beside the shepherds’ tents.
content_old: 8 If thou know not, O thou fairest among women, Go thy way forth by the footsteps of the flock, And feed thy kids beside the shepherds’ tents.

content: 9 I have compared thee, O my love, To a steed in Pharaoh’s chariots.
content_old: 9 I have compared thee, O my love, To a steed in Pharaoh’s chariots.

content: 10 Thy cheeks are comely with plaits of hair, Thy neck with strings of jewels.
content_old: 10 Thy cheeks are comely with plaits of hair, Thy neck with strings of jewels.

content: 11 We will make thee plaits of gold With studs of silver.
content_old: 11 We will make thee plaits of gold With studs of silver.

content: 12 While the king sat at his table, My spikenard sent forth its fragrance.
content_old: 12 While the king sat at his table, My spikenard sent forth its fragrance.

content: 13 My beloved is unto me as a bundle of myrrh, That lieth betwixt my breasts.
content_old: 13 My beloved is unto me as a bundle of myrrh, That lieth betwixt my breasts.

content: 14 My beloved is unto me as a cluster of henna-flowers In the vineyards of En-gedi.
content_old: 14 My beloved is unto me as a cluster of henna-flowers In the vineyards of En-gedi.

content: 15 Behold, thou art fair, my love; Behold thou art fair; Thine eyes are as doves.
content_old: 15 Behold, thou art fair, my love; Behold thou art fair; Thine eyes are as doves.

content: 16 Behold, thou art fair, my beloved, yea, pleasant: Also our couch is green.
content_old: 16 Behold, thou art fair, my beloved, yea, pleasant: Also our couch is green.

content: 1 I am a rose of Sharon, A lily of the valleys.
content_old: 1 I am a rose of Sharon, A lily of the valleys.

content: 2 As a lily among thorns, So is my love among the daughters.
content_old: 2 As a lily among thorns, So is my love among the daughters.

content: 3 As the apple-tree among the trees of the wood, So is my beloved among the sons. I sat down under his shadow with great delight, And his fruit was sweet to my taste.
content_old: 3 As the apple-tree among the trees of the wood, So is my beloved among the sons. I sat down under his shadow with great delight, And his fruit was sweet to my taste.

content: 4 He brought me to the banqueting-house, And his banner over me was love.
content_old: 4 He brought me to the banqueting-house, And his banner over me was love.

content: 5 Stay ye me with raisins, refresh me with apples; For I am sick from love.
content_old: 5 Stay ye me with raisins, refresh me with apples; For I am sick from love.

content: 6 His left hand is under my head, And his right hand doth embrace me.
content_old: 6 His left hand is under my head, And his right hand doth embrace me.

content: 7 I adjure you, O daughters of Jerusalem, By the roes, or by the hinds of the field, That ye stir not up, nor awake my love, Until he please.
content_old: 7 I adjure you, O daughters of Jerusalem, By the roes, or by the hinds of the field, That ye stir not up, nor awake my love, Until he please.

content: 8 The voice of my beloved! behold, he cometh, Leaping upon the mountains, Skipping upon the hills.
content_old: 8 The voice of my beloved! behold, he cometh, Leaping upon the mountains, Skipping upon the hills.

content: 9 My beloved is like a roe or a young hart: Behold, he standeth behind our wall; He looketh in at the windows; He glanceth through the lattice.
content_old: 9 My beloved is like a roe or a young hart: Behold, he standeth behind our wall; He looketh in at the windows; He glanceth through the lattice.

content: 10 My beloved spake, and said unto me, Rise up, my love, my fair one, and come away.
content_old: 10 My beloved spake, and said unto me, Rise up, my love, my fair one, and come away.

content: 11 For, lo, the winter is past; The rain is over and gone;
content_old: 11 For, lo, the winter is past; The rain is over and gone;

content: 12 The flowers appear on the earth; The time of the singing of birds is come, And the voice of the turtle-dove is heard in our land;
content_old: 12 The flowers appear on the earth; The time of the singing of birds is come, And the voice of the turtle-dove is heard in our land;

content: 13 The fig-tree ripeneth her green figs, And the vines are in blossom; They give forth their fragrance. Arise, my love, my fair one, and come away.
content_old: 13 The fig-tree ripeneth her green figs, And the vines are in blossom; They give forth their fragrance. Arise, my love, my fair one, and come away.

content: 14 O my dove, that art in the clefts of the rock, In the covert of the steep place, Let me see thy countenance, Let me hear thy voice; For sweet is thy voice, and thy countenance is comely.
content_old: 14 O my dove, that art in the clefts of the rock, In the covert of the steep place, Let me see thy countenance, Let me hear thy voice; For sweet is thy voice, and thy countenance is comely.

content: 15 Take us the foxes, the little foxes, That spoil the vineyards; For our vineyards are in blossom.
content_old: 15 Take us the foxes, the little foxes, That spoil the vineyards; For our vineyards are in blossom.

content: 16 My beloved is mine, and I am his: He feedeth his flock among the lilies.
content_old: 16 My beloved is mine, and I am his: He feedeth his flock among the lilies.

content: 1 By night on my bed I sought him whom my soul loveth: I sought him, but I found him not.
content_old: 1 By night on my bed I sought him whom my soul loveth: I sought him, but I found him not.

content: 2 I said, I will rise now, and go about the city; In the streets and in the broad ways I will seek him whom my soul loveth: I sought him, but I found him not.
content_old: 2 I said, I will rise now, and go about the city; In the streets and in the broad ways I will seek him whom my soul loveth: I sought him, but I found him not.

content: 3 The watchmen that go about the city found me; To whom I said, Saw ye him whom my soul loveth?
content_old: 3 The watchmen that go about the city found me; To whom I said, Saw ye him whom my soul loveth?

content: 4 It was but a little that I passed from them, When I found him whom my soul loveth: I held him, and would not let him go, Until I had brought him into my mother’s house, And into the chamber of her that conceived me.
content_old: 4 It was but a little that I passed from them, When I found him whom my soul loveth: I held him, and would not let him go, Until I had brought him into my mother’s house, And into the chamber of her that conceived me.

content: 5 I adjure you, O daughters of Jerusalem, By the roes, or by the hinds of the field, That ye stir not up, nor awake my love, Until he please.
content_old: 5 I adjure you, O daughters of Jerusalem, By the roes, or by the hinds of the field, That ye stir not up, nor awake my love, Until he please.

content: 6 Who is this that cometh up from the wilderness Like pillars of smoke, Perfumed with myrrh and frankincense, With all powders of the merchant?
content_old: 6 Who is this that cometh up from the wilderness Like pillars of smoke, Perfumed with myrrh and frankincense, With all powders of the merchant?

content: 7 Behold, it is the litter of Solomon; Threescore mighty men are about it, Of the mighty men of Israel.
content_old: 7 Behold, it is the litter of Solomon; Threescore mighty men are about it, Of the mighty men of Israel.

content: 8 They all handle the sword, and are expert in war: Every man hath his sword upon his thigh, Because of fear in the night.
content_old: 8 They all handle the sword, and are expert in war: Every man hath his sword upon his thigh, Because of fear in the night.

content: 9 King Solomon made himself a palanquin Of the wood of Lebanon.
content_old: 9 King Solomon made himself a palanquin Of the wood of Lebanon.

content: 10 He made the pillars thereof of silver, The bottom thereof of gold, the seat of it of purple, The midst thereof being paved with love, From the daughters of Jerusalem.
content_old: 10 He made the pillars thereof of silver, The bottom thereof of gold, the seat of it of purple, The midst thereof being paved with love, From the daughters of Jerusalem.

content: 1 Behold, thou art fair, my love; behold, thou art fair; Thine eyes are as doves behind thy veil. Thy hair is as a flock of goats, That lie along the side of mount Gilead.
content_old: 1 Behold, thou art fair, my love; behold, thou art fair; Thine eyes are as doves behind thy veil. Thy hair is as a flock of goats, That lie along the side of mount Gilead.

content: 2 Thy teeth are like a flock of ewes that are newly shorn, Which are come up from the washing, Whereof every one hath twins, And none is bereaved among them.
content_old: 2 Thy teeth are like a flock of ewes that are newly shorn, Which are come up from the washing, Whereof every one hath twins, And none is bereaved among them.

content: 3 Thy lips are like a thread of scarlet, And thy mouth is comely. Thy temples are like a piece of a pomegranate Behind thy veil.
content_old: 3 Thy lips are like a thread of scarlet, And thy mouth is comely. Thy temples are like a piece of a pomegranate Behind thy veil.

content: 4 Thy neck is like the tower of David Builded for an armory, Whereon there hang a thousand bucklers, All the shields of the mighty men.
content_old: 4 Thy neck is like the tower of David Builded for an armory, Whereon there hang a thousand bucklers, All the shields of the mighty men.

content: 5 Thy two breasts are like two fawns That are twins of a roe, Which feed among the lilies.
content_old: 5 Thy two breasts are like two fawns That are twins of a roe, Which feed among the lilies.

content: 6 Until the day be cool, and the shadows flee away, I will get me to the mountain of myrrh, And to the hill of frankincense.
content_old: 6 Until the day be cool, and the shadows flee away, I will get me to the mountain of myrrh, And to the hill of frankincense.

content: 7 Thou art all fair, my love; And there is no spot in thee.
content_old: 7 Thou art all fair, my love; And there is no spot in thee.

content: 8 Come with me from Lebanon, my bride, With me from Lebanon: Look from the top of Amana, From the top of Senir and Hermon, From the lions’ dens, From the mountains of the leopards.
content_old: 8 Come with me from Lebanon, my bride, With me from Lebanon: Look from the top of Amana, From the top of Senir and Hermon, From the lions’ dens, From the mountains of the leopards.

content: 9 Thou hast ravished my heart, my sister, my bride; Thou hast ravished my heart with one of thine eyes, With one chain of thy neck.
content_old: 9 Thou hast ravished my heart, my sister, my bride; Thou hast ravished my heart with one of thine eyes, With one chain of thy neck.

content: 10 How fair is thy love, my sister, my bride! How much better is thy love than wine! And the fragrance of thine oils than all manner of spices!
content_old: 10 How fair is thy love, my sister, my bride! How much better is thy love than wine! And the fragrance of thine oils than all manner of spices!

content: 11 Thy lips, O my bride, drop as the honeycomb: Honey and milk are under thy tongue; And the smell of thy garments is like the smell of Lebanon.
content_old: 11 Thy lips, O my bride, drop as the honeycomb: Honey and milk are under thy tongue; And the smell of thy garments is like the smell of Lebanon.

content: 12 A garden shut up is my sister, my bride; A spring shut up, a fountain sealed.
content_old: 12 A garden shut up is my sister, my bride; A spring shut up, a fountain sealed.

content: 13 Thy shoots are an orchard of pomegranates, with precious fruits; Henna with spikenard plants,
content_old: 13 Thy shoots are an orchard of pomegranates, with precious fruits; Henna with spikenard plants,

content: 14 Spikenard and saffron, Calamus and cinnamon, with all trees of frankincense; Myrrh and aloes, with all the chief spices.
content_old: 14 Spikenard and saffron, Calamus and cinnamon, with all trees of frankincense; Myrrh and aloes, with all the chief spices.

content: 15 Thou art a fountain of gardens, A well of living waters, And flowing streams from Lebanon.
content_old: 15 Thou art a fountain of gardens, A well of living waters, And flowing streams from Lebanon.

content: 1 I am come into my garden, my sister, my bride: I have gathered my myrrh with my spice; I have eaten my honeycomb with my honey; I have drunk my wine with my milk. Eat, O friends; Drink, yea, drink abundantly, O beloved.
content_old: 1 I am come into my garden, my sister, my bride: I have gathered my myrrh with my spice; I have eaten my honeycomb with my honey; I have drunk my wine with my milk. Eat, O friends; Drink, yea, drink abundantly, O beloved.

content: 2 I was asleep, but my heart waked: It is the voice of my beloved that knocketh, saying, Open to me, my sister, my love, my dove, my undefiled; For my head is filled with dew, My locks with the drops of the night.
content_old: 2 I was asleep, but my heart waked: It is the voice of my beloved that knocketh, saying, Open to me, my sister, my love, my dove, my undefiled; For my head is filled with dew, My locks with the drops of the night.

content: 3 I have put off my garment; how shall I put it on? I have washed my feet; how shall I defile them?
content_old: 3 I have put off my garment; how shall I put it on? I have washed my feet; how shall I defile them?

content: 4 My beloved put in his hand by the hole of the door, And my heart was moved for him.
content_old: 4 My beloved put in his hand by the hole of the door, And my heart was moved for him.

content: 5 I rose up to open to my beloved; And my hands dropped with myrrh, And my fingers with liquid myrrh, Upon the handles of the bolt.
content_old: 5 I rose up to open to my beloved; And my hands dropped with myrrh, And my fingers with liquid myrrh, Upon the handles of the bolt.

content: 6 I opened to my beloved; But my beloved had withdrawn himself, and was gone. My soul had failed me when he spake: I sought him, but I could not find him; I called him, but he gave me no answer.
content_old: 6 I opened to my beloved; But my beloved had withdrawn himself, and was gone. My soul had failed me when he spake: I sought him, but I could not find him; I called him, but he gave me no answer.

content: 7 The watchmen that go about the city found me, They smote me, they wounded me; The keepers of the walls took away my mantle from me.
content_old: 7 The watchmen that go about the city found me, They smote me, they wounded me; The keepers of the walls took away my mantle from me.

content: 8 I adjure you, O daughters of Jerusalem, If ye find my beloved, That ye tell him, that I am sick from love.
content_old: 8 I adjure you, O daughters of Jerusalem, If ye find my beloved, That ye tell him, that I am sick from love.

content: 9 What is thy beloved more than another beloved, O thou fairest among women? What is thy beloved more than another beloved, That thou dost so adjure us?
content_old: 9 What is thy beloved more than another beloved, O thou fairest among women? What is thy beloved more than another beloved, That thou dost so adjure us?

content: 10 My beloved is white and ruddy, The chiefest among ten thousand.
content_old: 10 My beloved is white and ruddy, The chiefest among ten thousand.

content: 11 His head is as the most fine gold; His locks are bushy, and black as a raven.
content_old: 11 His head is as the most fine gold; His locks are bushy, and black as a raven.

content: 12 His eyes are like doves beside the water-brooks, Washed with milk, and fitly set.
content_old: 12 His eyes are like doves beside the water-brooks, Washed with milk, and fitly set.

content: 13 His cheeks are as a bed of spices, As banks of sweet herbs: His lips are as lilies, dropping liquid myrrh.
content_old: 13 His cheeks are as a bed of spices, As banks of sweet herbs: His lips are as lilies, dropping liquid myrrh.

content: 14 His hands are as rings of gold set with beryl: His body is as ivory work overlaid with sapphires.
content_old: 14 His hands are as rings of gold set with beryl: His body is as ivory work overlaid with sapphires.

content: 15 His legs are as pillars of marble, set upon sockets of fine gold: His aspect is like Lebanon, excellent as the cedars.
content_old: 15 His legs are as pillars of marble, set upon sockets of fine gold: His aspect is like Lebanon, excellent as the cedars.

content: 1 Whither is thy beloved gone, O thou fairest among women? Whither hath thy beloved turned him, That we may seek him with thee?
content_old: 1 Whither is thy beloved gone, O thou fairest among women? Whither hath thy beloved turned him, That we may seek him with thee?

content: 2 My beloved is gone down to his garden, To the beds of spices, To feed in the gardens, and to gather lilies.
content_old: 2 My beloved is gone down to his garden, To the beds of spices, To feed in the gardens, and to gather lilies.

content: 3 I am my beloved’s, and my beloved is mine: He feedeth his flock among the lilies.
content_old: 3 I am my beloved’s, and my beloved is mine: He feedeth his flock among the lilies.

content: 4 Thou art fair, O my love, as Tirzah, Comely as Jerusalem, Terrible as an army with banners.
content_old: 4 Thou art fair, O my love, as Tirzah, Comely as Jerusalem, Terrible as an army with banners.

content: 5 Turn away thine eyes from me, For they have overcome me. Thy hair is as a flock of goats, That lie along the side of Gilead.
content_old: 5 Turn away thine eyes from me, For they have overcome me. Thy hair is as a flock of goats, That lie along the side of Gilead.

content: 6 Thy teeth are like a flock of ewes, Which are come up from the washing; Whereof every one hath twins, And none is bereaved among them.
content_old: 6 Thy teeth are like a flock of ewes, Which are come up from the washing; Whereof every one hath twins, And none is bereaved among them.

content: 7 Thy temples are like a piece of a pomegranate Behind thy veil.
content_old: 7 Thy temples are like a piece of a pomegranate Behind thy veil.

content: 8 There are threescore queens, and fourscore concubines, And virgins without number.
content_old: 8 There are threescore queens, and fourscore concubines, And virgins without number.

content: 9 My dove, my undefiled, is but one; She is the only one of her mother; She is the choice one of her that bare her. The daughters saw her, and called her blessed; Yea, the queens and the concubines, and they praised her.
content_old: 9 My dove, my undefiled, is but one; She is the only one of her mother; She is the choice one of her that bare her. The daughters saw her, and called her blessed; Yea, the queens and the concubines, and they praised her.

content: 10 Who is she that looketh forth as the morning, Fair as the moon, Clear as the sun, Terrible as an army with banners?
content_old: 10 Who is she that looketh forth as the morning, Fair as the moon, Clear as the sun, Terrible as an army with banners?

content: 11 I went down into the garden of nuts, To see the green plants of the valley, To see whether the vine budded, And the pomegranates were in flower.
content_old: 11 I went down into the garden of nuts, To see the green plants of the valley, To see whether the vine budded, And the pomegranates were in flower.

content: 12 Before I was aware, my soul set me Among the chariots of my princely people.
content_old: 12 Before I was aware, my soul set me Among the chariots of my princely people.

content: 1 How beautiful are thy feet in sandals, O prince’s daughter! Thy rounded thighs are like jewels, The work of the hands of a skilful workman.
content_old: 1 How beautiful are thy feet in sandals, O prince’s daughter! Thy rounded thighs are like jewels, The work of the hands of a skilful workman.

content: 2 Thy body is like a round goblet, Wherein no mingled wine is wanting: Thy waist is like a heap of wheat Set about with lilies.
content_old: 2 Thy body is like a round goblet, Wherein no mingled wine is wanting: Thy waist is like a heap of wheat Set about with lilies.

content: 3 Thy two breasts are like two fawns That are twins of a roe.
content_old: 3 Thy two breasts are like two fawns That are twins of a roe.

content: 4 Thy neck is like the tower of ivory; Thine eyes as the pools in Heshbon, By the gate of Bath-rabbim; Thy nose is like the tower of Lebanon Which looketh toward Damascus.
content_old: 4 Thy neck is like the tower of ivory; Thine eyes as the pools in Heshbon, By the gate of Bath-rabbim; Thy nose is like the tower of Lebanon Which looketh toward Damascus.

content: 5 Thy head upon thee is like Carmel, And the hair of thy head like purple; The king is held captive in the tresses thereof.
content_old: 5 Thy head upon thee is like Carmel, And the hair of thy head like purple; The king is held captive in the tresses thereof.

content: 6 How fair and how pleasant art thou, O love, for delights!
content_old: 6 How fair and how pleasant art thou, O love, for delights!

content: 7 This thy stature is like to a palm-tree, And thy breasts to its clusters.
content_old: 7 This thy stature is like to a palm-tree, And thy breasts to its clusters.

content: 8 I said, I will climb up into the palm-tree, I will take hold of the branches thereof: Let thy breasts be as clusters of the vine, And the smell of thy breath like apples,
content_old: 8 I said, I will climb up into the palm-tree, I will take hold of the branches thereof: Let thy breasts be as clusters of the vine, And the smell of thy breath like apples,

content: 9 And thy mouth like the best wine, That goeth down smoothly for my beloved, Gliding through the lips of those that are asleep.
content_old: 9 And thy mouth like the best wine, That goeth down smoothly for my beloved, Gliding through the lips of those that are asleep.

content: 10 I am my beloved’s; And his desire is toward me.
content_old: 10 I am my beloved’s; And his desire is toward me.

content: 11 Come, my beloved, let us go forth into the field; Let us lodge in the villages.
content_old: 11 Come, my beloved, let us go forth into the field; Let us lodge in the villages.

content: 12 Let us get up early to the vineyards; Let us see whether the vine hath budded, And its blossom is open, And the pomegranates are in flower: There will I give thee my love.
content_old: 12 Let us get up early to the vineyards; Let us see whether the vine hath budded, And its blossom is open, And the pomegranates are in flower: There will I give thee my love.

content: 1 Oh that thou wert as my brother, That sucked the breasts of my mother! When I should find thee without, I would kiss thee; Yea, and none would despise me.
content_old: 1 Oh that thou wert as my brother, That sucked the breasts of my mother! When I should find thee without, I would kiss thee; Yea, and none would despise me.

content: 2 I would lead thee, and bring thee into my mother’s house, Who would instruct me; I would cause thee to drink of spiced wine, Of the juice of my pomegranate.
content_old: 2 I would lead thee, and bring thee into my mother’s house, Who would instruct me; I would cause thee to drink of spiced wine, Of the juice of my pomegranate.

content: 3 His left hand should be under my head, And his right hand should embrace me.
content_old: 3 His left hand should be under my head, And his right hand should embrace me.

content: 4 I adjure you, O daughters of Jerusalem, That ye stir not up, nor awake my love, Until he please.
content_old: 4 I adjure you, O daughters of Jerusalem, That ye stir not up, nor awake my love, Until he please.

content: 5 Who is this that cometh up from the wilderness, Leaning upon her beloved? Under the apple-tree I awakened thee: There thy mother was in travail with thee, There was she in travail that brought thee forth.
content_old: 5 Who is this that cometh up from the wilderness, Leaning upon her beloved? Under the apple-tree I awakened thee: There thy mother was in travail with thee, There was she in travail that brought thee forth.

content: 6 Set me as a seal upon thy heart, As a seal upon thine arm: For love is strong as death; Jealousy is cruel as Sheol; The flashes thereof are flashes of fire, A very flame of Jehovah.
content_old: 6 Set me as a seal upon thy heart, As a seal upon thine arm: For love is strong as death; Jealousy is cruel as Sheol; The flashes thereof are flashes of fire, A very flame of Jehovah.

content: 7 Many waters cannot quench love, Neither can floods drown it: If a man would give all the substance of his house for love, He would utterly be contemned.
content_old: 7 Many waters cannot quench love, Neither can floods drown it: If a man would give all the substance of his house for love, He would utterly be contemned.

content: 8 We have a little sister, And she hath no breasts: What shall we do for our sister In the day when she shall be spoken for?
content_old: 8 We have a little sister, And she hath no breasts: What shall we do for our sister In the day when she shall be spoken for?

content: 9 If she be a wall, We will build upon her a turret of silver: And if she be a door, We will inclose her with boards of cedar.
content_old: 9 If she be a wall, We will build upon her a turret of silver: And if she be a door, We will inclose her with boards of cedar.

content: 10 I am a wall, and my breasts like the towers thereof Then was I in his eyes as one that found peace.
content_old: 10 I am a wall, and my breasts like the towers thereof Then was I in his eyes as one that found peace.

content: 11 Solomon had a vineyard at Baal-hamon; He let out the vineyard unto keepers; Every one for the fruit thereof was to bring a thousand pieces of silver.
content_old: 11 Solomon had a vineyard at Baal-hamon; He let out the vineyard unto keepers; Every one for the fruit thereof was to bring a thousand pieces of silver.

content: 12 My vineyard, which is mine, is before me: Thou, O Solomon, shalt have the thousand, And those that keep the fruit thereof two hundred.
content_old: 12 My vineyard, which is mine, is before me: Thou, O Solomon, shalt have the thousand, And those that keep the fruit thereof two hundred.

content: 13 Thou that dwellest in the gardens, The companions hearken for thy voice: Cause me to hear it.
content_old: 13 Thou that dwellest in the gardens, The companions hearken for thy voice: Cause me to hear it.
